original_solution_mapping.L1: May will be able to make 2 x 3 = <<2*3=6>>6 red scarves.
original_solution_mapping.L2: She will be able to make 3 x 6 = <<3*6=18>>18 blue scarves.
original_solution_mapping.L3: And she will be able to make 4 x 3 = <<4*3=12>>12 yellow scarves.
original_solution_mapping.L4: Therefore the total scarves she can make is 12 + 18 + 6 = <<12+18+6=36>>36.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 292.
    Returns: the total number of scarves May can make.
    """
    # L1
    red_yarns = 2 # 2 red yarns
    scarves_per_yarn = 3 # 3 scarves using one yarn
    red_scarves = red_yarns * scarves_per_yarn

    # L2
    blue_yarns = 6 # 6 blue yarns
    blue_scarves = scarves_per_yarn * blue_yarns

    # L3
    yellow_yarns = 4 # 4 yellow yarns
    yellow_scarves = yellow_yarns * scarves_per_yarn

    # L4
    total_scarves = yellow_scarves + blue_scarves + red_scarves

    # FA
    answer = total_scarves
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: May will be able to make {red_yarns} x {scarves_per_yarn} = <<{red_yarns}*{scarves_per_yarn}={red_scarves}>>{red_scarves} red scarves.
She will be able to make {scarves_per_yarn} x {blue_yarns} = <<{scarves_per_yarn}*{blue_yarns}={blue_scarves}>>{blue_scarves} blue scarves.
And she will be able to make {yellow_yarns} x {scarves_per_yarn} = <<{yellow_yarns}*{scarves_per_yarn}={yellow_scarves}>>{yellow_scarves} yellow scarves.
Therefore the total scarves she can make is {yellow_scarves} + {blue_scarves} + {red_scarves} = <<{yellow_scarves}+{blue_scarves}+{red_scarves}={total_scarves}>>{total_scarves}.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: She will be able to make 6 x 6 = <<6*6=36>>36 blue scarves.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: And she will be able to make 4 x 3 = <<4*3=12>>12 yellow scarves.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: Therefore the total scarves she can make is 12 + 36 + 6 = <<12+36+6=54>>54.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'red_scarves' (6) was used instead of 'scarves_per_yarn' (3).
